title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Ukraine
summary:
The document titled "Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Ukraine" outlines the decision made by the President to extend the national emergency initially declared on March 6, 2014, due to the ongoing threats posed by actions of the Russian government towards Ukraine. This emergency was declared under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, citing threats to Ukraine's democratic processes, peace, sovereignty, and territorial integrity.

The President has issued several executive orders over the years, expanding the scope of this emergency in response to the Russian Federation's actions, including the annexation of Crimea and the recognition of regions in Ukraine that contradict international agreements. The most recent extension will continue the national emergency for another year, as the threats to U.S. national security and foreign policy remain significant.

The key implications of this continuation include the persistence of economic sanctions and other measures against Russia, aimed at addressing its aggressive policies towards Ukraine. The document emphasizes the necessity of maintaining these measures to safeguard U.S. interests and support Ukraine's sovereignty.
